item.title: Are Russian bots manipulating Turkish social media?
item.description: Thousands of Russian-speaking Twitter accounts that had been previously inactive have been reopened as Turkish accounts. This is weeks ahead of the May 14 elections in Turkey, raising fears about possible election manipulation through social media.
item.keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content, Russia, Turkey, election, foreign, interference, influence, pre-election, manipulation, social media
item.media:title: Are Russian bots manipulating Turkish social media?
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,Russia, Turkey, election, foreign, interference, influence, pre-election, manipulation, social media

item.title: Hunting Kashmir's 'mushroom gold' Morchella
item.description: Morchella mushrooms are among the most expensive in the world. Two mushroom hunters talk to DW about their day jobs.
item.keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content, Morchella mushrooms, culinary delicacy, high market value, valuable commodity, mushroom hunting, foraging, day jobs, nature enthusiasts, sustainable sourcing, environmental conservation, food

item.title: The health hazard in Indonesian instant noodles
item.description: In some packets of Indomie noodles, ethylene oxide was detected. Exposure to ethylene oxide can lead to cancer.
item.keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content, Indonesia, food safety concerns, contamination, chemical exposure, health risks, carcinogenic properties, hazardous chemicals, product recalls, consumer safety, toxic substances, quality control issues

item.description: With Portugal being Europeâ€™s top tourism destination, Lisbon has become too expensive for its own residents to live in.

item.title: Indian journalist gives women a voice on climate change
item.description: Varsha Raikwar fights climate change by creating radio content to inspire the rural population to get involved in India. Her special focus: getting women to participate.

item.title: Soccer playing robot: Is it over for Ronaldo?
item.description: This humanoid robot can run, maintain balance and kick a ball like a pro. And it could also pave the way for even more advanced robotic innovations. Will robots outplay humans in the near future?
item.keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content, Ronaldo, football, soccer, robotics, humanoid, technoloy, AI, artificial intelligence

item.title: Telegram refuses to provide user data of violent neo-Nazis in Brazil
item.description: Telegram refused to provide user data of violent neo-Nazis to Brazilian authorities citing privacy concerns. This raises the question of whether user data should be disclosed if they are suspected of breaking the law.
item.keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content, Telegram, privacy, user data, neo-Nazis, Brazilian authorities, law enforcement, data protection, civil liberties, digital rights, government surveillance, violence
item.media:title: Telegram refuses to provide user data of violent neo-Nazis in Brazil
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content, Telegram, privacy, user data, neo-Nazis, Brazilian authorities, law enforcement, data protection, civil liberties, digital rights, government surveillance, violence

item.title: The Wagner Group: Russia's Shadow Mercenary Organization
item.description: Uncovering the shadowy world of the Wagner Group: a mercenary organization with links to Vladimir Putin, accused of war crimes and geopolitical meddling.
item.keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content, Russia, Wagner group, military, private army, Putin, war crimes, Ukraine, Africa, covert operations
